sub_title: Aiming to move things with low/no carbon: Decarbonizing transport, logistics and shipping
summary:
• 14+ years of experience and strongly committed and client-focused climate change and ESG Expert, helping organizations understand their impact on climate change, define decarbonization strategies to reduce that impact and creating the awareness of the financial impact of climate risks on organizations.
• Love new challenges, get out of my comfort zone, work in multicultural team, develop younger professionals and eager to create value through win-win outcomes to achieve goals and targets (not only companies' but also Global goals)
• On-the-ground experience working on different global-scale projects both in developed (e.g. France, Australia, Canada, Chile) and emerging countries (e.g. Vietnam, India, Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Indonesia, Malaysia)

FUN FACTS
• Australian & French citizen, US Green Card holder, fluent in English, French and Spanish with notions of Mandarin.
• Expat experience in Asia, Australia, the US, South America and Europe.
• Positive attitude and sense of humor appreciated by stakeholders in times of stress or crisis.
• Safari guide in Southern Africa, allowing to connect business context with an on-the-ground experience
• Favorite quotes that translates my state-of-mind: “Past is history, future is mystery, present is a gift, this is what it is called present” and “further together”

Views expressed are my own.

Moller - Maersk', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFxaOJ8VzplhA/company-logo_400_400/0/1616162064676?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=JfnMdGZVejm9RELzfoD-_QFfOX827rZL5HGdPMsP78Q', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/maersk-group/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Copenhagen Metropolitan Area', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'A.P. Moller - Maersk', 'description': None, 'title': 'Head of Energy Transition (Transparency & Enablement), Senior Director', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'FSB Task Force on Climate Financial Disclosures (TCFD)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'FSB Task Force on Climate Financial Disclosures (TCFD)', 'description': 'The Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) formed the Advisory Group on Climate-related Scenario Guidance in November 2019 to assist in developing practical guidance on climate-related scenario analysis. 

In its 2018 and 2019 status reports, the TCFD noted that many companies found scenario analysis to be challenging. Specifically, companies have faced challenges with constructing appropriate scenarios, understanding how scenario analysis informs strategy formulation, and determining and disclosing the resiliency of a company’s strategy under different climate-related scenarios. In response to these challenges, the TCFD will provide guidance on implementing scenario analysis to better understand how climate-related issues could affect their business strategies. The TCFD’s goal is to provide some of the building blocks that support disclosure of companies’ strategy resilience. 

The guidance targets companies that are in the early stages of implementing scenario analysis, and will cover:
• Scenario concepts and processes
• How business-relevant scenarios can be constructed 
• How scenarios can aid the identification of company-relevant climate-related risks and opportunities
• How scenarios can inform strategic planning regarding different potential impacts from climate change
• Disclosure considerations to demonstrate strategy resilience across scenarios, including financial implications', 'title': 'TCFD Advisory Group Member (Climate Scenario Guidance)', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2525300, 'name': 'KPMG', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQFrqkKAlHCfyA/company-logo_400_400/0/1688581211794?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=lBtdhwZezygqq414F89zSnYvhC2lu5ksCELvLAwLAgE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/kpmg/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'KPMG', 'description': None, 'title': 'Director, KPMG Global Decarbonization center', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Région de Amsterdam, Pays-Bas', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'KPMG', 'description': '* CLIMATE RISKS SERVICE LEAD AND CHAIR OF THE GLOBAL NETWORK: guiding clients in making sense of what climate risks are, what their mean for them and their sectors with the use of scenario analysis and finding the mitigation actions, without missing out on the opportunities. Overall, helping companies being future proof. 

CONCRETLY:
   • Identification of climate sensitivities
• Workshop leader with senior management to test the identified sensitivities
• Scenario development for 2ºC and 4ºC, using IPCC/IEA/IRENA scenarios, enriched with tailored PESTEL (Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Environmental and Legal) driving forces
• Stress-testing and quantification on climate sensitivities against the different scenarios
• Identification of mitigation and adaptation options
• Integration of climate risks and opportunities into ERM processes and business functions

* DECARBONIZATION SERVICE LEAD FOR THE DUTCH FIRM: advising clients on their race to Net-Zero, what is means for them in terms of market positioning, feasibility, CAPEX, OPEX, GHG reduction and effort implications and supporting with their climate action narrative for public disclosure.

CONCRETLY:
• Identification hotspots for decarbonization solutions, right ambition, insights into the EU ETS and compliance offsets market, voluntary markets, in-setting, impact investing, internal carbon pricing implementation.
• Identification of hotspots (type of emissions, countries, products, brands) 
• Selection of possible decarbonization solutions current, maturing and in development
• Prioritization of decarbonization solutions, based on timing horizon, probability of deployment, level of investment required, high level cost/benefit, GHG reduction potential. 

* ESG STRATEGY: guiding clients on their ESG strategy (focus on E and S), making sense of circular economy, understanding how ESG fit into their overall strategy, mostly looking for value creation opportunities with ESG as a key driver for growth.', 'title': 'Climate Risks and Decarbonization Lead | Strategic Advisor', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Melbourne / Sydney', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'KPMG', 'description': 'KEY INDUSTRIES
• Mining, Power generation and electricity transmission
• Infrastructure, construction and engineering
• Banking and financial services
• Property, hotels and hospitality

KEY SKILLS DEMONSTRATED 
• Strong analytical skills: collect relevant information and data, analyse them and come up with a creative solution
• High level of initiatives: not only to identify where action is needed, but to respond in a timely manner
• Tenacity to overcome obstacles and maintain energy in order to deliver results
• Flexibility in adapting style and working practices, proven through my career choices
• Strong interpersonal skills as a team leader

KEY RESPONSIBILITES 
• Lead GRI G4 audit engagements with multi-disciplinary, multi-location teams and complex operations drawing on capabilities in business, risk, environmental matters, social studies, compliance, human rights
• Work collaboratively with client to build trusts and help them succeed in their strategy
• Business development to keep adding value to existing clients and target new ones

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS 
• Initiated and lead a National assurance efficiency program to improve audit methodology and reduce cost
• Contributed to the development of staffs through trainings and measurement of performance as a Performance Manager
• Achieved successfully internal targets
• Participated in writing articles for external publication
• Collaborated with multi-locations teams (UK, HK, Chile, South Africa, Columbia)
• Acted as a technical Expert on a number of technical topics', 'title': 'Associate Director ESG consultant - Mining, power utility, high-emitter industry focus', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Based in Australia & France', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'KPMG', 'description': 'FOCUS AREAS 
• Nuclear: Technical & Financial expert for nuclear decommissioning of classified installations, uranium enrichment and chemical processes, storage of Long-Life High-Activity nuclear wastes and recycling of wastes
• Aviation: Financial expert for the maintenance and overhaul of aircrafts (bodies and engines)

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
• Development of a risk-based approach: review of internal control and industrial processes and identification of financial risks
• Audit of financial statements under IFRS, US, Australian and French GAAP: Plan and perform procedures, including identification and resolution of critical issues for both public and private sectors. 
• Financial Market Data​: control of documents issued in connection with transactions covered by the AMF (Autorité des marchés financiers) or ASIC (Australian Securities and Investments Commission)
• Budget: establishment and follow-up of audit engagement budget

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS 
• Managed large teams in a challenging environment, under pressure to meet deadlines
• Contributed to the development of others by training staff and evaluating performance
• Participated to major meetings with clients in senior executive positions, including AGM and Board meetings
• Contributed actively to the recruitment of talents', 'title': 'Manager Financial Audit - Nuclear decomissioning expert', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1723489, 'name': 'Beaudrey - Paris, France', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHzpxl-sJsOUA/company-logo_400_400/0/1611649669214?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=vsG5hxYXu474IEQSxFz1Gp1a9K5zJiHOCotDMsW_f-8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/beaudrey/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2005}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2005}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'company': 'BEAUDREY', 'description': 'Beaudrey is specialized in the design and manufacturing of filtration equipment for power plants, industry and water treatment.
